contentrichtext.text: '''Sir Richard Downes Jackson''' [[Order of the Bath|KCB]] (1777 – June 9, 1845), born at [[Petersfield]] in the [[England|English]] county of [[Hampshire]], was [[List of Lieutenant-Governors of Ontario|Administrator]] of [[Canada West]] and [[Canada East]] (1841–1842) until the arrival of Sir [[Charles Bagot]] who took the position of [[Governor General]] of the [[Province of Canada]]. == External links == *[http://www.biographi.ca/009004-119.01-e.php?&id_nbr=3461 Biography at the ''Dictionary of Canadian Biography Online''] {{s-start}} {{s-gov}} {{s-bef| rows = 2 | before = [[John Clitherow]] }} {{s-ttl| title = [[List of Lieutenant-Governors of Ontario|Lieutenant-Governor of Canada West]]| | years = 1841 – 1842 }} {{s-aft| rows = 2 | after = [[Charles Bagot|Sir Charles Bagot]] }} {{s-ttl| title = [[List of Lieutenant Governors of Quebec|Lieutenant Governor of Canada East]] | years = 1841 – 1842 }} {{s-end}} {{ONLG}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Jackson, Richard Downes | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = British Army general | DATE OF BIRTH = 1777 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Petersfield, Hampshire | DATE OF DEATH = June 9, 1845 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Jackson, Richard Downes}} [[Category:1777 births]] [[Category:1845 deaths]] [[Category:Governors General of the Province of Canada]] [[Category:Lieutenant Governors of Canada West]] [[Category:People from Petersfield]] [[Category:British Army generals]] [[Category:People of the Irish Rebellion of 1798]] [[Category:British Army personnel of the French Revolutionary Wars]] [[Category:British Army personnel of the Napoleonic Wars]] [[Category:Knights Commander of the Order of the Bath]] {{Canada-viceroy-stub}}
